thread.title: PREP VOLLEYBALL: North Super Regional awaits 5 local squads
thread.title_full: PREP VOLLEYBALL: North Super Regional awaits 5 local squads

author: jwinfrey@cullmantimes.com(Jake Winfrey)
title: PREP VOLLEYBALL: North Super Regional awaits 5 local squads
text:
by Jake Winfrey 
Rosemary Brown isn’t sailing away into the sunset without a fight. 
The longtime Good Hope volleyball coach and her Class 4A No. 4 Raiders begin their quest for a 13th state tournament appearance together Friday in the North Super Regional Tournament at Huntsville’s Von Braun Civic Center. 
Brown, who’ll retire at season’s end after 38 years atop the program, has 17 county championships and 21 area tournament titles on her resume. 
Good Hope (51-6) is looking to add a 4A crown to that list. 
Meanwhile, 2A No. 2 Addison has its sight set on a third consecutive state championship. The Bulldogs downed Donoho in the 1A final back in 2013 before defeating Providence Christian in the 2A title match last season. 
Those triumphs, however, came under Pam Wilkins, who resigned back in January. Fortunately for Addison, it hasn’t missed a beat under new coach Kayla Woodard, who played for Wilkins and Mississippi State prior taking on an assistant role at the school in 2013. 
As respective area tournament champs, Good Hope, Addison and Holly Pond drew area tourney runners-up for Friday's first round of the 1A-6A North Super Regional. 
The Raiders duke it out with Elkmont at 6:45 p.m., the Bulldogs take on Gaston at 6:45 p.m. and the Broncos mix it up No. 6 Madison Academy at 12:45 p.m. in the 3A bracket. 
St. Bernard (1A, Area 11 RU) and West Point (5A, Area 14 RU) have tall orders versus Brilliant and No. 8 Alexandria, respectively. The Saints take the court at 11:30 a.m., while the Warriors play at 10:15 a.m. 
The event wraps up on Saturday, with squads needing a pair of victories between both days of action — the semis, finals and third-place match are solely for seeding purposes — to advance to the Elite 8, which is slated for next Wednesday and Thursday at the Birmingham CrossPlex.
